Title: Data Analyst - Metals
Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst – Metals Sector




We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.




Responsibilities:

Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including:

Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager.

Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.

Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Basic programming skills, especially in Python.
Basic modeling skills.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.

The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.




Why ecoinvent?

As a fast-growing team based in Zürich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.




Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.




Our Mission

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database—a comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.




Interested in this unique opportunity?

Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date.




Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Title: Data Analyst (Junior)
Description:
Data Analyst (Junior) vacancy for our Zurich based client in the Banking sector.


Your tasks:

Supporting risk specialists in conducting regular risk assessments, identifying potential risks, and documenting findings
Creating and maintaining dashboards using Excel and Tableau
Preparing comprehensive reports for senior management
Managing risk and compliance documentation, ensuring all records are up-to-date
Developing and managing macros for team efficiency


Your experience/knowledge:

3+ years of experience in Data Analytics or Risk Compliance Quality Assurance
Proficiency in Excel, with general knowledge of Tableau
Experience in testing control, with a background in compliance, audit or risk management, ideally within the banking sector
Familiarity with topics related to markets, products, investment and financial crime
Language skills: English - fluent, German would be advantageous



Your soft skills:

Excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail
A high degree of self-organisation and time management



Location: Zurich, Switzerland
Work setting: On-Site
Sector: Banking
Start: 08/2024
Duration: 12MM+
Workload: 100%
Ref.Nr.: BH 21293

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Production, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la récolte, l'analyse et l'interprétation des données afin d’élaborer des stratégies d'amélioration pour le site de Production des Acacias.

Responsabilités


Contribuer activement à différentes initiatives du site en établissant les indicateurs clés pour le suivi efficace du projet
Récupérer puis traiter des données issues de sources variées telles que ERP, PLM, MES, LES, ou directement des équipements
Présenter les résultats analysés en utilisant des outils de visualisation de données pour faciliter la compréhension
Comprendre les problématiques métier et les traduire de manière analytique
Collaborer avec le département informatique pour automatiser le traitement des flux de données.
Garder une veille technologique active sur les nouveaux outils et méthodes d'analyse de données


Profil


Ingénieur HES, EPF ou équivalent
Connaissance des outils de traitement et d’analyse de données (Python, Dataiku, Tableau PREP, KNIME ou équivalent), de visualisation (TABLEAU) et base de données
Fortes compétences organisationnelles et autonomie
Aisance relationnelle, écoute, capacité de synthèse et communication efficace
Dynamisme, flexibilité et esprit d'équipe


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Title: Data Analyst & Compliance
Description:
At Taleo we are looking for a Data Analyst to join as soon as possible one of our big banking clients in Zürich.




About the Role




Data Analyst Tasks:

Prepare reports, statistics and ad-hoc requests for dashboard and KPI reporting for senior management committee
Consolidate input from international locations on GMC applicability, implementation and results for key stakeholders, Risk Type Owners and Senior Management.
Manage the GMC deviation/non-applicability workflow tool and related processes.
Support the roll-out and implementation of the GMC in newly established/acquired entities of the group.
Provide guidance on the GMC framework and tools to the international locations for the implementation of the relevant local key controls and the reporting of the control results.
Ensure adequate communication of revised and new GMCs to the relevant international locations.
Support the Quality Assurance Framework (tracking, consolidation of results & reporting)
Create supporting material (manuals, training material, SOPs. Creation of internal dashboards etc.) for Internal Control Framework and Quality Assurance Framework
Support performance Quality Assurance testing of ICF (design and operating effectiveness).




Quality Assurance Officer Tasks:

Perform Quality Assurance testing of ICF (design and operating effectiveness) in areas of Markets Compliance, Financial Crime Compliance, Investment Products and Services amongst others
Manage the planning, tracking, testing, consolidation of results and reports of the Quality Assurance Framework
Prepare reports, statistics and ad-hoc requests for dashboard and KPI reporting for senior management committee
Support the consolidation of input from international locations on GMC applicability, implementation and results for key stakeholders, Risk Type Owners and Senior Management.
Create supporting material (manuals, training material, SOPs etc.) for Quality Assurance Framework and Internal Control Framework




Required skills:

4 years of experience in banking as Audit or Compliance Analyst background with excellent data analyst skills
Data Analyst position -> Well versed with Excel and Access functionalities (VBA), Power BI, Tableau
Quality Assurance officer position -> Control testing experience (1LoD or 2LoD) in areas of Markets Compliance, Investment Products and Services and Financial Crime Compliance amongst others
German fluent (C1/C2)
English fluent (C1/C2)

Title: Research Assistant (VLBI Data Analysis)
Company: Amt für Informatik und Organisation des Kantons Bern (KAIO)
Description:
100%

The Satellite Geodesy research group of the Astronomical Institute of the University of Bern (AIUB) offers the position of a Research Assistant.

The focus of the activities will be in the field of extending the capability of the Bernese GNSS Software package for VLBI Data analysis.

Tasks

Based on the initial developments related to observation handling and the combined processing of satellites with quasars the full capability of an analysis center of the IVS (International VLBI Service for Geodesy and Astronomy) shall be established using the Bernese GNSS Software package. This development shall be carried out in a close cooperation with BKG (Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy, Frankfurt am Main, Germany). The activity is established within the framework of the institutional collaboration: “Center for Orbit Determination in Europe (CODE)”. A refinement of the observation modelling is still needed. At the same time, the robust data processing procedure shall be developed allowing a highly automated VLBI data analysis. The development is supported by IAPG at TUM (Institute of Astronomical and Physical Geodesy; Technical University of Munich) where an initial prototype implementation was established.

The development shall allow in future research in the field of a combined analysis of VLBI and GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite Systems) measurements – in particular preparing the GENESIS mission. It is of course intended that the successful candidate shall start with scientific experiments in that field with the available functionality.

Education

The candidate is expected to have successfully completed the master thesis (diploma / “Lizentiat”) preferably in astronomy, geodesy, physics, or a related topic. Experience in VLBI and/or GNSS data processing or in using the Bernese GNSS Software package, and in computer science (coding in modern Fortran, C++, or perl) are not a requirement, but an advantage. The candidate should be able to speak and write English fluently.

The candidate should start working in Bern as soon as possible.

The position is scheduled for three years. It can be extended depending on the progress in the project.

The salary follows the guidelines of the University of Bern and depends on the qualification of the successful candidate.

Application

Applications (including CV, University Diploma Copies, Possible References) Should Be Received As Soon As Possible But No Later Than August 09, 2024 At The Following Address

Prof Dr. Rolf Dach

Leiter Satellitengeodäsie Gruppe

Astronomisches Institut

Universität Bern

Sidlerstrasse 5

CH-3012 Bern

Phone: ++41 31 684 85 93, E-mail: rolf.dach@unibe.ch

Informal enquiries may be obtained at the above address as well.

The University of Bern is an equal opportunity employer and encourages in particular women to apply for open positions.

www.karriere.unibe.ch Legal Notice

Apply now

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Responsabilità:


Collaborare e comunicare in modo efficace con differenti cross-functional teams per definire e raccogliere i requisiti sui dati.
Supportare le analisi in gestione al business:

Redigere specifiche tecnico/funzionali per il team di sviluppo nel contesto DataWarehouses.
Implementare processi di import e storicizzazione del dato in modalità batch/near real time nel contesto DataLake [BigQuery su piattaforma Google Cloud].


Ottimizzare l'architettura delle varie data platform per le esigenze aziendali.
Documentare le pipeline di dati, i processi e le best practice per una corretta condivisione con il team.


Competenze Richieste:


3+ anni di esperienza e familiarità con data warehousing e cloud platforms in ambito servizi finanziari.
Conoscenza esperta di SQL e Python (librerie pandas, numpy).
2+ anni di esperienza su Google Cloud BigQuery e altri servizi di Google Cloud Platform.
Capacità di ottimizzare i processi e l'infrastruttura dei dati in termini di efficienza, scalabilità ed economicità.
Conoscenza di JIRA e di altri strumenti di gestione del lavoro Agile (Confluence).


Competenze Aggiuntive (Plus):


Conoscenze di Tool di Data Visualization (ad esempio Power BI).
Conoscenze di Qlik Replicate.
Esperienze recenti nel ruolo di Cloud Data Architect.


Capacità Richieste:


Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
Attitudine analitica e orientamento al problem solving.
Attitudine alla comunicazione e al lavoro in team.
Proattività.


Desired Skills and Experience

Experis è una società leader a livello globale nel campo del reperimento di risorse umane e nelle soluzioni per la forza lavoro basate su progetti. Con sede in oltre 50 paesi, Experis fornisce talenti di alta qualità e soluzioni innovative per aiutare le aziende a raggiungere i propri obiettivi commerciali. I servizi offerti includono il reclutamento di personale specializzato nell'IT e nell'ingegneria, la gestione di progetti, il reclutamento professionale e i servizi gestiti. Concentrandosi sull'offrire esperienza e valore ai clienti in svariati settori, Experis aiuta le aziende a superare le sfide della forza lavoro attuale e a raggiungere il successo.

Title: CSV Engineer
HTML:
To support on multiple projects, we are looking for a temporary CSV Engineer


Role Purpose:


  • Supporting assigned project(s) in Visp as CSV-Engineer;
  • Create the requested CSV documents according Lonza SOP’s;
  • Execute the CSV tests;
  • Support the CSV timelines with PM & CQV-Lead;
  • Close interaction with Process Engineers, Automation Team (EMR), PM and QA;
  • Forcing the Lonza CQV/CSV Approach during the entire project.


Accountabilities & Duties:


  • Acting as subject matter expert (SME) on following Lonza CQV / CSV standards;
  • CSV person of contact of the assigned system till the handover to the operation organization;
  • Participate to the system impact assessment as CSV SME;
  • Define with EMR and Package Units vendor the most appropriate design for vertical;integration in the Lonza environment;
  • Create the requested CSV documents according Lonza SOP’s and Guidelines;
  • Organize the reviews of the CSV documents till last QA approval;
  • Participate to the FAT & SAT;
  • Create the tests protocols and execute the tests;
  • Close collaboration with CSV Lead or CQV Lead;
  • Responsible for ensuring that SGIE projects in Visp are compliant with the global CQV guidelines, aligned with local procedures and detect/resolve potential gaps in line with Lonza’s continuous improvement vision;
  • Participate in inspection as Lonza Project CSV-representative.

Candidate profile :


  • Technical degree (bachelor level) in engineering or applied science, post graduate qualification preferred;
  • Significant experience in automation;
  • Extensive experience in vertical integration and data management under validated computer systems;
  • Minimum of 5+ years in Commissioning, Qualification and Validation incl. CSV with strong experience in management of complex pharmaceutical projects. Familiarity with biologics (mammalian, CGT) as well as chemical manufacturing technologies desirable;
  • Significant experience in regulated pharmaceutical industry and/or engineering company with proven experience on planning CQV activities, leading large senior reports and high understanding/management of KPIs;
  • Strong knowledge of ISPE GAMP5 and ASTM guidelines with proven experience on large and complex projects. Proven management experience in an EMA / FDA regulated environmental with very good knowledge of current ICH, PIC/S, EU and US regulatory requirements and their implementation;
  • Experience in People Management (internal and external) with respect to organizational aspects, coaching and development;
  • Languages: Excellent command of English and proven knowledge in German necessary (read and write) and other desirable;
  • Agility - Must be able to learn, understand and apply new CQV processes and tools.
  • Knowledge and skills;
  • Solid collaboration and influencing skills and the ability to work together with teams and individuals in a highly matrix environment;
  • Strong analytical skills. Ability to conduct in-depth analysis of complex/large data sets, draw conclusions accordingly, and prepare and support decisions;
  • Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented environment;
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment;
  • Strong written and oral communication skills;
  • Willing and able to train/support colleagues.

Title: Data Insights Specialist
Description:
Unsere Kundin ist ein mittelgrosses, schweizweit tätiges Unternehmen im Gesundheitsbereich. Durch die laufende Integration in eine weltweit tätige Firmengruppe besteht ein spannendes Setup: Es müssen verschiedene BI-Systeme angebunden werden, und dafür besteht viel Gestaltungsfreiheit.




Data Insights Specialist




Deine Aufgaben

Verantwortlich für die Führung und Optimierung des BI-Systems
Ansprechpartner/in für interne Kunden bezüglich Reporting und Datenvisualisierung
Erfassen der Bedürfnisse und Anforderungen der Fachabteilungen sowie des Senior Managements, und Eruieren der erforderlichen Datenquellen und Reports
Erstellung, Dokumentation und Weiterentwicklung diverser Reports und Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Entscheidungsfindung
Enge Kooperation mit den Fachexperten der Geschäftsbereiche




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik (Bachelor oder Master)
Mehrjährige Praxiserfahrung mit etablierten BI-Systemen (wie Qlik, Power BI, etc.)
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, hohe Kunden- und Teamorientierung
Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten
Grosses Interesse an BI und Lernfreude
Verhandlungssichere Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse




Was dir diese Stelle bietet

Umfassende Rolle, von Requirements Engineering bis zur Umsetzung
Hoher Gestaltungsspielraum, grosse Freiheit und Flexibilität
Zeitgemässe Systemlandschaft mit aktueller Infrastruktur
Bis zu 80% Remote Work möglich




Interessiert?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Kontaktaufnahme. Ein Anschreiben ist keines nötig.

HTML:
Unsere Kundin ist ein mittelgrosses, schweizweit tätiges Unternehmen im Gesundheitsbereich. Durch die laufende Integration in eine weltweit tätige Firmengruppe besteht ein spannendes Setup: Es müssen verschiedene BI-Systeme angebunden werden, und dafür besteht viel Gestaltungsfreiheit.


Data Insights Specialist


Deine Aufgaben

  • Verantwortlich für die Führung und Optimierung des BI-Systems
  • Ansprechpartner/in für interne Kunden bezüglich Reporting und Datenvisualisierung
  • Erfassen der Bedürfnisse und Anforderungen der Fachabteilungen sowie des Senior Managements, und Eruieren der erforderlichen Datenquellen und Reports
  • Erstellung, Dokumentation und Weiterentwicklung diverser Reports und Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Entscheidungsfindung
  • Enge Kooperation mit den Fachexperten der Geschäftsbereiche


Dein Profil

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik (Bachelor oder Master)
  • Mehrjährige Praxiserfahrung mit etablierten BI-Systemen (wie Qlik, Power BI, etc.)
  • Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, hohe Kunden- und Teamorientierung
  • Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten
  • Grosses Interesse an BI und Lernfreude
  • Verhandlungssichere Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse


Was dir diese Stelle bietet

  • Umfassende Rolle, von Requirements Engineering bis zur Umsetzung
  • Hoher Gestaltungsspielraum, grosse Freiheit und Flexibilität
  • Zeitgemässe Systemlandschaft mit aktueller Infrastruktur
  • Bis zu 80% Remote Work möglich


Interessiert?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Kontaktaufnahme. Ein Anschreiben ist keines nötig.

Title: Data and Analytics Engineer
Description:
For our client based in Basel, CH, we are looking for Data and Analytics Engineer.




Its a 3 year contract role with relocation package.




Responsibilities-




• directly contribute to our mission as a part of collaborative team who are solving a range of complex software and data challenges, including IT product and data management, advanced analytics, and business intelligence.




• help us explore and exploit cutting-edge technologies, including big data platforms and machine learning.




• find yourself looking outwards and collaborating; not just among the team but with expert economists, technologists, data scientists and statisticians – and counterparts in other international organisations and central banks.




• benefit from a working in a unique, international environment that offers flexible, hybrid working options with a blend of onsite work from our central office location in Basel and home office.




• Supporting the Monetary and Economic Department (MED) in the effective provisioning, development and use of business applications and contributing to defining and implementing the IT strategy and architecture for MED statistical applications.




• Managing MED IT’s product portfolio and assume related procurement, contract, budget and reporting responsibilities.




• Providing IT / administrative support to MED IT users, customers, and steering committees.







Qualifications, skills, and experience:

• Graduate degree in computer science or another IT-related technical field or equivalent

experience.

• Experience in managing IT products including budgeting, procuring and contract management.

• Experience in supporting a large IT customer base (3rd level support), including excellent communication skills.

• Programming skills in languages like Python, C# .NET, Java.

• Experience in working with economic and financial statistics (using data science tools).

• Knowledge and experience on working with SQL and various databases.

• Strong analytical skills and passion for solving data challenges is required to be successful in this role

Title: SAP Master Data Analyst
Description:
Experis is the global leader in professional resourcing and project-based workforce solutions.

On beahlf of our Pharmaceutical company in Basel, we are recruiting for a SAP Master Data Analyst

The perfect candidate:
You are someone who is motivated by challenges. Analyzing data and understanding it is your passion. You also have the ability to look for the smallest details but not lose sight of the big picture. In addition to your IT skills, you also want to build up and expand your business knowledge and are very enthusiastic about learning.

General Information:

* Start date: 01.09.2024
* Planned duration: 30.08.2024
* Extension (in case of limitation): possible
* Workplace: Kaiseraugst
* Workload: 100%
* Remote/Home Office: 3 days minimum onsite

Tasks & Responsibilities:



Create and maintain new material and product master data templates
Ensure availability of test data for upcoming SAP deployment activities
Coordinate with local SAP development team for data export/imports
Perform overall Master Data activities such as reporting, analysis, requirements gathering, etc
Join and/or complete Data Migration and Testing related workshops/trainings
Perform or ensure data cleansing tasks are completed on time
Complete data collection for manual/construction objects on time
Perform and confirm value mapping performed by the Deployment Functional Data Owners
Create and maintain master lists, if applicable, for assigned object
Provide business insights and information to technical teams for extraction and conversion from the legacy system(s) for assigned data objects
Ensure data readiness and verify quality throughout data journey for assigned data objects
Verify/validate that the data is fit for purpose (including alignment with internal/external stakeholders) and check upload files before and after load for all assigned data objects
Perform manual (type-in) data loads into target clients for assigned objects (if applicable)
Coordinate with local experts to collect and validate business requirements for material and product master data


Must Haves:

Bachelor's and University Degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance, Accounting, Education, Engineering, Business/Administration, Management, Information Systems, Information Technology
5+ years of experience in a similar role
Experience with Materials and Production Master Data
Experience as technical and functional tester
Tools and systems proficiency: SAP ERP (R3 & S4 HANA); SAP MDG-M, SAP DS/IS, SAP BW, BW/4HANA; SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau or QlikView, SAP Solution Manager
Excellent analytical mindset with ability to communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key stakeholders
Strong communication, networking skills, someone who enjoys working with others and acts as a team player
Strong customer centric, solution-oriented mindset with the ability to propose different solutions for the customers' needs
Strategic and holistic mindset with the ability to manage topics in agile / matrix organizations
Familiar and comfortable with agile ways of working and adaptable to changing environments
English is a must
Skills with Excel Macros, Google office (e.g. G-sheets is a nice to have), database management


Nice to Have:

German would be helpful
SAP Certifications, PMP, ITIL

If this job interests you please do send us your CV today through the link in the advert. However, should you have any questions please contact Elaine Kanwar at +41 61 282 22 23

Title: Visualizations Developer
Description:
The perfect candidate:

The mission of our team is to enable access and work with research data generated during early lead identification and optimization campaigns.

We are looking for a highly motivated Visualizations Developer focusing on developing and maintaining visualizations in Spotfire or Dash Spotly to join our team.

General Information:

• Start date: asap

Tasks & Responsibilities:

Developing and maintaining a dashboard in Spotfire or Dash Spotly for visualizing operational data from drug discovery programs:

• Designing and developing visualizations and dashboards that allow users to intuitively understand key characteristics of their data in Spotfire

• Implementing statistical metrics that are meaningful to visualize key performance indicators

• Suggest new visualizations based on input from business analysts

• Collaborate with a data engineer to define required data transformations and formats

• Document the data flow, configuration, and usage of the implemented solutions

Stack:

• Spotfire and/or Dash Plotly for dashboard development

• Plotly for custom visualizations (optional)

• Python for custom data transformations

• PostgreSQL as the data source

• Lucid Spark for mapping ideas, wireframing, and collaboration

• Gitlab for task and code tracking

• OneDocs for documentation

Must Haves:

• Experience : Strong data visualization skills in e.g. Spotfire or Dash Plotly. Some background in data science (basic statistics). Experience with different visualization platforms. Focus on user-friendly and intuitive design. (*****)

• Execution: You have a passion for working in an environment with high urgency, and you like creating and refining meaningful visualizations in an iterative manner. (*****)

• Proficiency: You’re mastering one or multiple visualization platforms at an advanced level (TIBCO Spotfire preferred). (*****)

• Curiosity and Creativity: You are eager to learn about the key questions in our project and come up with your own ideas to tackle these challenges

• Interest: You understand biomedical or preclinical research data or have previously worked in a Pharma domain.

• Communication : You offer excellent communication skills in English and feel comfortable directly interacting with team members and stakeholders (*****)

Skills:


Development
spotfy
dash plotly

Title: Internship - Data Analytics (Zurich, Switzerland)
Description:
What It's About

We are looking for an Intern to join our Data Office by September 2024 for 4 to 6 months

The main tasks will be the following:


Analyze data about companies in the CRM and Investment sourcing system and develop a model that identifies uniqueness, proposing cleansing actions to data stewards.
Analyze data about companies across various systems, including the mapping from disparate application models to the unified model of the master data system, to propose de-duplication & mapping logic to be applied during data integration & mastering.
Apply PG's AI LLM solutions to prototype an implementation that recognizes core entities within unstructured documents leveraging the pre-trained models with vectorized additional proprietary Partners Group input.



What We Expect


Top performing students in the final phase of their study or who recently graduated from a top university, ideally focused on Computer Science or a Quantitative Degree
Initial work experience in renowned firms in Technology, Data, Analytics or Consultancy is mandatory
Proficiency using AI, LLMs or other data science approaches and Python coding skills
Ability to complete projects on time and accurately, and to multi-task
Strong analytical and people skills with excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to learn and succeed
Proficiency in English is required



What We Offer


Insights into and learnings into the data and analytics space from the world of investments at one of the world's leading private markets investment firms
Flat management structure with significant exposure to senior leaders and decision makers
Steep personal and technical learning curve in a supporting environment with a high degree of ownership and autonomy, yet with structured feedback and training



www.partnersgroup.com

Please be aware, fraudsters may pose as Partners Group recruiters. All genuine representatives can be identified by a verified sign on their LinkedIn profiles. If you suspect fraud or have doubts, contact us immediately at hr@partnersgroup.com

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Senior Data Engineer - Remote / Switzerland - Pharmaceutical




We have an opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer who is ready to take their career to the next level with the opportunity to move into a leadership role.




Our client is a global Pharmaceutical organisation who's head office is situated in Basel, Switzerland and offering a fully remote work capacity. Operating in 97 countries and a headcount of over 5000, this is one of the most successful organisations in their field.




You will have the opportunity to work with some of the best Data Architects within the Swiss market, learn from the best and move into a leadership opportunity of your own.




Here are some Requirements:

6+ years experience as a Data Engineer
Proven experience within Azure Data Factory
Data warehousing experience
Excellent skills within Python and SQL
Ambition to move into leadership




All positions comes with the following benefits:

Annual bonus of 17.5%
Private healthcare
Unlimited budget for personal development
Company car allowance or Travel paid for




Location: Remote / Switzerland

Salary: 150 - 170k CHF Base




Interested? Please apply directly or contact steven@interex-group.com for some further details.

Title: Chargé de projets Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Achats, Soutien & Infrastructures, nous recherchons un Chargé de projets Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera de contribuer à la maturité de la division dans l’exploitation et l’interprétation des données.

Responsabilités


Contribuer au support et à l’animation du réseau de compétences Data au sein de la division
Recenser, analyser, prioriser et répondre aux besoins de données exprimés par les clients internes en collaboration avec la division informatique
Contribuer, prioriser et coordonner la collecte des données sources de la division
Développer et concevoir des tableaux de bord sur l’outil Tableau pour répondre aux besoins transverses
Soutenir l’analyse des solutions utilisées et en assurer la qualité
Soutenir et former les utilisateurs aux bonnes pratiques sur la gestion et l’utilisation des outils et des données
Contribuer à la veille sur les évolutions techniques en partenariat avec la division informatique


Profil


Formation universitaire d’ingénieur généraliste (EPF), informatique, en management ou formation jugée équivalente
Minimum 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire
Solides connaissances des modèles de données de production et de logistique
Expérience confirmée en analyse métier
Maîtrise des outils de Business Intelligence (Tableau, Excel VBA, PowerQuery) et des outils bureautiques
Aisance relationnelle, aptitude à travailler en équipe
Excellentes capacités à communiquer et à fédérer
Personne autonome, flexible, rigoureuse et organisée
Fort esprit analytique, approche systémique et esprit de synthèse


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Title: Senior Security Analyst
Description:
Challenge:




Utilize your analytical thinking to develop high-quality security solution proposals and decision-making foundations.
Conduct or oversee vulnerability and penetration tests on our monitored environments, preparing the necessary reports.
Collaborate with the team to capture, actively develop, and document security system architectures.
Create guidelines for evaluating and procuring security components, support your team with special assignments, and monitor technical developments in ICT security.
Follow up on security incidents, with the entire Security Operations Team analyzing causes and impacts.
Provide professional support to the CSIRT in handling security-related incidents.




What You Bring:




Advanced education in Information Technology (e.g., HF, FH, federal diploma).
Several years of professional experience in a similar role.
Expertise in information security, cyber security, and threat analysis.
Excellent German and good English skills.
Solid knowledge and practical application of network and security concepts.
Willingness to work night and weekend shifts (including on-call duty).

Title: Internship Global Master Data Analyst
Description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Key Responsibilities

The Master Data department in Visp is a global team responsible for the development of master data processes and standards that are to be followed by the whole organization. As a trainee, you will be responsible to:


Perform various data analyses and reports to support Master data or Business projects
Support with SAP Master data mass maintenance and migration projects
Gather feedbacks from global and local Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) within the organization
Define functional and technical requirements for the development/enhancement of new Master Data processes
Improve and enhance our training documentation as well as providing direct trainings to various teams within Lonza


As a member of the Global Master Data team, you will be able to learn SAP Materials Management (MM), Production & Planning (PP) and Sales & Distribution (SD) modules, key business processes as well as SAP data structures. Overall, you will interact with many different departments and experts across the company worldwide.

Key Requirements


You have a Bachelor or Master degree in data or computer science, business information technology, or mathematics.
You have an understanding of data structures or experience with databases.
You are fluent in English. German and any additional language will be an appreciated asset.
You are interested in continuous improvements of processes, IT tools and innovative solutions.
You are interested in being a reliable team member in a multi-cultural environment.


Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.
Show more
HTML:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Key Responsibilities

The Master Data department in Visp is a global team responsible for the development of master data processes and standards that are to be followed by the whole organization. As a trainee, you will be responsible to:

  • Perform various data analyses and reports to support Master data or Business projects
  • Support with SAP Master data mass maintenance and migration projects
  • Gather feedbacks from global and local Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) within the organization
  • Define functional and technical requirements for the development/enhancement of new Master Data processes
  • Improve and enhance our training documentation as well as providing direct trainings to various teams within Lonza

As a member of the Global Master Data team, you will be able to learn SAP Materials Management (MM), Production & Planning (PP) and Sales & Distribution (SD) modules, key business processes as well as SAP data structures. Overall, you will interact with many different departments and experts across the company worldwide.

Key Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor or Master degree in data or computer science, business information technology, or mathematics.
  • You have an understanding of data structures or experience with databases.
  • You are fluent in English. German and any additional language will be an appreciated asset.
  • You are interested in continuous improvements of processes, IT tools and innovative solutions.
  • You are interested in being a reliable team member in a multi-cultural environment.

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Title: Data Specialist
Description:
Description De L'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.

Si notre mission vous inspire, venez forger votre propre chemin au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Description Du Poste

Rattaché au Data Office et partie prenante de l’équipe IT/Digital, le Data Specialist occupe un rôle clé au sein du Data Office et sera un interlocuteur privilégié des équipes métiers et des équipes internes Data Office. Il interviendra pour recueillir, analyser et challenger leurs demandes. Réel support fonctionnel, il est en mesure d’appréhender rapidement les différentes problématiques métiers soumis, et d’établir les premiers livrables clés nécessaires à la mise en œuvre de leurs demandes.

Dans Ce Cadre-là


Vous êtes capable de conduire des ateliers fonctionnels de recueil et d’analyser des besoins et en assurez la restitution.
Vous collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes métiers, producteurs et utilisateurs de données pour définir les objets métiers exposés et assurerez du niveau de documentation associé.
Vous définirez et cartographierez les relations entre objets à un niveau conceptuel en collaboration avec la cellule architecture.
Vous donnerez les moyens concrets de faire évoluer la stratégie des actions de l’équipe Data en se basant sur les données collectées.
Vous remonterez au Data Architect les besoins en termes de structuration et d’intégration de données.
Vous proposerez des KPI en lien avec des problématiques de qualité de données et proposerez des règles de mises en qualité.
Vous enrichirez le catalogue de données afin de garantir un lineage et une documentation technico-fonctionnelle de qualité.


Qualifications


Au bénéfice d’un master dans le domaine de l’ingénierie informatique et/ou des études statistiques, vous justifiez d’une première expérience en qualité d’Analyste/ Data Specialist / Consultant Data / Data Engineer.
Vous avez d’excellentes connaissances des environnements d’ensembles de données importants, des bases de données relationnelles (SQL) et des logiciels de gouvernance de la donnée (Data Catalog, MDM).
Vous avez des compétences en modélisation des bases de données ainsi qu’en cartographie des données.
Vous avez une bonne connaissance de l’industrie horlogère.
Vous avez une bonne capacité à travailler en équipes projets transverses avec des intervenants internes et externes, y compris à l’international et vous savez vulgariser les concepts techniques.
Vous avez un sens de la rigueur, de la confidentialité en raison de la sensibilité de certaines données et avez une aisance relationnelle.
Vous maîtrisez parfaitement le français et avez de très bonnes connaissances de l’anglais.


Informations supplémentaires

Ce Que Nous Offrons


Les assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
5 semaines annuelles de congé avec 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles ;
Des coachings sportifs individuels et en groupe
Des contributions à vos activités sportives ou culturelles ainsi qu’aux abonnements encourageant la mobilité douce (CFF par exemple)
Parkings gratuits et recharge offerte pour les voitures électriques ;
Possibilité de travailler à distance depuis plusieurs sites (GE/VD/NE) ;
Une LPP avec des taux avantageux


Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.
Show more

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Title: BI Analyst/Campaign Data Analyst
Description:
Du arbeitest in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Marketingmanagern, um neue Kampagnen zu entwickeln und Business Stakeholder mit datenbasierten Analysen zu unterstützen. Deine Verantwortungsbereiche umfassen die technische Umsetzung der Datenselektionen für Marketing-Kampagnen sowie die Gewährleistung der Datenqualität. Mit deinen Kenntnissen in SAS/SQL und Python programmierst du die Targeting-Logik für spezifische Kampagnen. Darüber hinaus bist du bereit, Kampagnen in das neue BSI-Kampagnentool zu migrieren, um 1:1-Kampagnen durch triggerbasierte, individuell angepasste Echtzeit-Events zu optimieren.



Möglichkeit, in einem spannenden Umfeld mit zukunftsorientierten Technologien zu arbeiten
Freiraum und Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten im Team
Chance, das zukünftige Marketing mitzugestalten
Innovatives und agiles Teamumfeld



Deine Skills



Abgeschlossenes Studium (Uni/FH) in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Data Science oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Gute Kenntnisse in Python und SQL sowie in der Datenanalyse, idealerweise auch in SAS und BSI
Praktische Erfahrungen in der effizienten und ergebnisorientierten Umsetzung von businessrelevanten Anforderungen
Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch



Was dich auszeichnet



Interesse und Erfahrung im Umfeld von Daten-Analyse/Selektion und Direktmarketing sowie Hands-on Mentalität
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und Cloudtechnologien (AWS) von Vorteil
Marketingaffinität mit guter Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit
Reisebereitschaft zwischen den Standorten Bern und Zürich



Was du draus machst, ist was uns ausmacht.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
We are seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our client's team in the Zug area.




In this role, your primary responsibilities will include advising on data and reporting and defining requirements, and managing the migration of legacy data to the cloud. You will ensure the quality of BI applications and communicate with both internal and external stakeholders.




If you hold a university degree in business informatics or a related field, have several years of experience in business intelligence, SAP BW, and strong knowledge of Power BI, cloud technologies (Snowflake or Azure), and SQL, along with fluency in both German and English, then this opportunity is ideal for you!




If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com!

Show more
HTML:
We are seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our client's team in the Zug area.


In this role, your primary responsibilities will include advising on data and reporting and defining requirements, and managing the migration of legacy data to the cloud. You will ensure the quality of BI applications and communicate with both internal and external stakeholders.


If you hold a university degree in business informatics or a related field, have several years of experience in business intelligence, SAP BW, and strong knowledge of Power BI, cloud technologies (Snowflake or Azure), and SQL, along with fluency in both German and English, then this opportunity is ideal for you!


If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
An alle Data Engineers!

Unser erfahrener Data Engineer Lionel ist auf der Suche nach einem ebenso enthusiastischen Sparringpartner, der mit ihm zusammen einen bahnbrechenden Data Hub aufbauen möchte. In der aktuellen Umgebung hast du die einzigartige Chance, etwas Grosses von Grund auf zu gestalten und mit deinem Know-how und deiner Leidenschaft zu 100% Teil dieses und vieler weiterer aufstrebender Projekte zu werden. Sei von Anfang an dabei und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der Datenverarbeitung!

Tönt spannend? Dann schick uns deine Unterlagen; auf ein Motivationsschreiben verzichten wir.
 
Data Engineer
 
80-100%

Aufgaben

Selbständiges Durchführen von Geschäftsanalysen unter Einbeziehung der Business Stakeholder, um Anforderungen zu identifizieren und zu verstehen. (Requirements Engineering)
Entwicklung und Erstellung von Datenmodellen sowie Gestaltung von Datenarchitekturen zur Gewährleistung einer effizienten Datenverarbeitung
Aufbau und Implementierung von ETL/ELT-Prozessen auf der Azure Plattform, unter Verwendung von Tools wie Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Explorer und Azure Synapse
Verantwortung für den operativen Betrieb der Datenlösungen inklusive Monitoring und Wartung, um eine reibungslose Funktionalität sicherzustellen
Aktive Mitarbeit im Change-, Problem- und Incident-Management, um schnelle Lösungen für auftretende Herausforderungen zu gewährleisten und Veränderungen effektiv zu begleiten

 
Anforderungen

Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Informatiker:in, Wirtschaftsinformatiker:in, Mathematiker:in oder Statistiker:in und bereits drei Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer
Du kannst auf konzeptionelle Erfahrung in der Einführung und Umsetzung von cloudbasierten Big Data Projekten, insbesondere auf Microsoft Azure und Microsoft Fabric, zurückgreifen
Deine Kenntnisse in MS Fabric, SQL, Python und KQL ermöglichen dir eine effiziente Datenverarbeitung und -analyse
Erfahrungen mit Azure DevOps über den gesamten Software Development Life Cycle zeichnen dich aus
Du kannst Microsoft Power BI sicher nutzen, um Daten für Reports und Analysen zu importieren
Durch deine ausgeprägten kommunikativen Fähigkeiten bist du in der Lage, erfolgreich mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu interagieren
Deutschkenntnisse auf Muttersprachniveau in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Position zwingend

 
Kontakt
Stefan Wittenberg
Leiter ICT Operations, Infrastructure & Data
+41 58 359 59 05
Sven Eugster
Talent Acquisition Specialist
+41 58 359 53 05

Wer wir sind
EKZ ist einer der grössten Energiedienstleister der Schweiz und versorgt rund eine Million Menschen mit Strom – zuverlässig, ökologisch und günstig. Die rund 1'300 Mitarbeitenden der EKZ-Gruppe setzen sich für eine nachhaltige Energiezukunft ein: mit Produkten aus 100 Prozent erneuerbaren Energiequellen, dem konsequenten Ausbau von Wind-, Wasser- und Solarenergie sowie smarten Technologien. EKZ plant, baut und unterhält ein rund 15'000 Kilometer langes und mit 99.998 Prozent überdurchschnittlich verfügbares Stromnetz. Zu den Kunden von EKZ zählen Private, Unternehmen und andere Schweizer Energieversorger. Als einer der grössten Ausbildner im Kanton Zürich bildet EKZ rund 150 Fachkräfte in neun Lehrberufen aus.

Arbeitsort
Zürich
 

 

Show more

Title: Data Insights Specialist
Description:
Unsere Kundin ist ein mittelgrosses, schweizweit tätiges Unternehmen im Gesundheitsbereich. Durch die laufende Integration in eine weltweit tätige Firmengruppe besteht ein spannendes Setup: Es müssen verschiedene BI-Systeme angebunden werden, und dafür besteht viel Gestaltungsfreiheit.




Data Insights Specialist




Deine Aufgaben

Verantwortlich für die Führung und Optimierung des BI-Systems
Ansprechpartner/in für interne Kunden bezüglich Reporting und Datenvisualisierung
Erfassen der Bedürfnisse und Anforderungen der Fachabteilungen sowie des Senior Managements, und Eruieren der erforderlichen Datenquellen und Reports
Erstellung, Dokumentation und Weiterentwicklung diverser Reports und Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Entscheidungsfindung
Enge Kooperation mit den Fachexperten der Geschäftsbereiche




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik (Bachelor oder Master)
Mehrjährige Praxiserfahrung mit etablierten BI-Systemen (wie Qlik, Power BI, etc.)
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, hohe Kunden- und Teamorientierung
Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten
Grosses Interesse an BI und Lernfreude
Verhandlungssichere Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse




Was dir diese Stelle bietet

Umfassende Rolle, von Requirements Engineering bis zur Umsetzung
Hoher Gestaltungsspielraum, grosse Freiheit und Flexibilität
Zeitgemässe Systemlandschaft mit aktueller Infrastruktur
Bis zu 80% Remote Work möglich




Interessiert?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Kontaktaufnahme. Ein Anschreiben ist keines nötig.

Show more

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
60-100%, Lausanne and home office

As a Power BI Specialist, you enrich our team and take our data analysis and visualization skills to the next level. You are responsible for the design, development and optimization of Power BI solutions and enable employees to work with Power BI.

How You Make a Difference


You are responsible for the development and stability of the Power BI platform, for defining the framework conditions and ensuring compliance with processes and governance guidelines.
As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven organization and empower staff through training and learning paths.
You contribute your expert knowledge in business analysis, consulting and implementation of complex requirements for customers, and optimize Power BI reports and dashboards to ensure smooth performance.
You liaise with various stakeholders and simplify processes, ensuring greater efficiency.
Your tasks involve working closely with data scientists and data engineers, as well as mentoring internal and external staff.
You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that Support requests are processed efficiently.



What You Have To Offer


You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics.
You have practical knowledge of Power BI, including data integration, dashboard creation and DAX calculations.
You are able to create complex data models and transform data from multiple sources.
Additional knowledge of other BI tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau and SAP Datasphere round off your profile.
You have an excellent spoken and written command of German and English. Any other national language is an advantage.



If you are an enthusiastic data expert and have the skills listed above, we look forward to receiving your application!

What We Have To Offer


6 weeks' holiday
Parental Leave
Mobile and flexible working
Fair employment conditions
Half Fare Travelcard or contribution towards GA
Support with basic and advanced training
Staff vouchers



Contact

Jan Locher Head of Business Intelligence

+41 76 367 90 16

Annual gross salary at 100%

CHF 98'000 - 118'000 Effective salary may differ from this salary range depending on experience and skills

Employment level

60-100%

Permanent

Job location(s)

Lausanne and home office

Swiss Post unit

Informatik / Technologie

IT/Technology

As the driving force behind digitization, the Informatics/Technology function unit has an influence on the whole of Swiss Post and is an important partner in its success. We go beyond core IT tasks and empower the company in its digital transformation. We use the latest technologies and work to advance agile, bimodal and embedded IT innovations. We develop new, secure business models and ensure that Swiss Post has a modern, high-performing ICT infrastructure. In addition, we are committed to the issue of sustainability: our headquarters in Bern have been awarded two certificates for sustainability. All newly built logistics centers meet the Gold sustainability standard at a minimum.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
FORFIRM is providing solutions to real business challenges for our clients through innovation and deep industry understanding. We pride ourselves on being a knowledge-based company, with no barriers or pre-built solutions – we listen to our clients and solve their unique problems.

At FORFIRM, we are creating a culture where each person can define their own role parameters and speak their mind without any hesitation. We are a true meritocracy, where individual results define each person’s career path.

We are looking for an experienced and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our lively international team and work on projects for Europe's leading brands!

Responsibility


Implementation and monitoring of data to ensure integrity and accuracy.
Development and maintenance of data quality reports.
Design of logical and conceptual data models to meet business requirements.
Collaboration with data architects and developers.
Analysis of large datasets to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate on strategic data projects for BANK clients and serve as the primary contact for data preparation.
Take the lead in overseeing various technical reporting areas, including responsibility for enhancing the CRM data mart, data modeling, data governance and compliance reporting, and conceptualizing and implementing financial accounting reporting



Skills Required


Completed training in business informatics or comparable higher education
Several years of professional experience in the field of banking / financial services in the field of DWH / reporting
Expert in PL / SQL
Phyton script languade experience
Expert in Power BI or similar BI tools
Organizational and conceptual skills as well as a structured and independent way of working
High service orientation and quality awareness in a very dynamic environment
Confident appearance and strong communication skills in English
Commitment to a culture of inclusion and appreciation of diverse perspectives



What We Offer


Opportunity to work on international multi-disciplinary projects for leading brands from day one
Highly meritocratic environment – points-based bonus and promotion system
A focus on knowledge building with regular internal and external training opportunities
Flexible working hours and smart-working environment
Opportunities to travel and work abroad
Supportive and dynamic team



FORFIRM is an equal opportunities employer that values diversity within the company. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination about race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Show more

Title: Data and Analytics Engineer
Description:
For our client based in Basel, CH, we are looking for Data and Analytics Engineer.




Its a 3 year contract role with relocation package.




Responsibilities-




• directly contribute to our mission as a part of collaborative team who are solving a range of complex software and data challenges, including IT product and data management, advanced analytics, and business intelligence.




• help us explore and exploit cutting-edge technologies, including big data platforms and machine learning.




• find yourself looking outwards and collaborating; not just among the team but with expert economists, technologists, data scientists and statisticians – and counterparts in other international organisations and central banks.




• benefit from a working in a unique, international environment that offers flexible, hybrid working options with a blend of onsite work from our central office location in Basel and home office.




• Supporting the Monetary and Economic Department (MED) in the effective provisioning, development and use of business applications and contributing to defining and implementing the IT strategy and architecture for MED statistical applications.




• Managing MED IT’s product portfolio and assume related procurement, contract, budget and reporting responsibilities.




• Providing IT / administrative support to MED IT users, customers, and steering committees.







Qualifications, skills, and experience:

• Graduate degree in computer science or another IT-related technical field or equivalent

experience.

• Experience in managing IT products including budgeting, procuring and contract management.

• Experience in supporting a large IT customer base (3rd level support), including excellent communication skills.

• Programming skills in languages like Python, C# .NET, Java.

• Experience in working with economic and financial statistics (using data science tools).

• Knowledge and experience on working with SQL and various databases.

• Strong analytical skills and passion for solving data challenges is required to be successful in this role

Title: SAP Master Data Analyst
Description:
Experis is the global leader in professional resourcing and project-based workforce solutions.

On beahlf of our Pharmaceutical company in Basel, we are recruiting for a SAP Master Data Analyst

The perfect candidate:
You are someone who is motivated by challenges. Analyzing data and understanding it is your passion. You also have the ability to look for the smallest details but not lose sight of the big picture. In addition to your IT skills, you also want to build up and expand your business knowledge and are very enthusiastic about learning.

General Information:

* Start date: 01.09.2024
* Planned duration: 30.08.2024
* Extension (in case of limitation): possible
* Workplace: Kaiseraugst
* Workload: 100%
* Remote/Home Office: 3 days minimum onsite

Tasks & Responsibilities:



Create and maintain new material and product master data templates
Ensure availability of test data for upcoming SAP deployment activities
Coordinate with local SAP development team for data export/imports
Perform overall Master Data activities such as reporting, analysis, requirements gathering, etc
Join and/or complete Data Migration and Testing related workshops/trainings
Perform or ensure data cleansing tasks are completed on time
Complete data collection for manual/construction objects on time
Perform and confirm value mapping performed by the Deployment Functional Data Owners
Create and maintain master lists, if applicable, for assigned object
Provide business insights and information to technical teams for extraction and conversion from the legacy system(s) for assigned data objects
Ensure data readiness and verify quality throughout data journey for assigned data objects
Verify/validate that the data is fit for purpose (including alignment with internal/external stakeholders) and check upload files before and after load for all assigned data objects
Perform manual (type-in) data loads into target clients for assigned objects (if applicable)
Coordinate with local experts to collect and validate business requirements for material and product master data


Must Haves:

Bachelor's and University Degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance, Accounting, Education, Engineering, Business/Administration, Management, Information Systems, Information Technology
5+ years of experience in a similar role
Experience with Materials and Production Master Data
Experience as technical and functional tester
Tools and systems proficiency: SAP ERP (R3 & S4 HANA); SAP MDG-M, SAP DS/IS, SAP BW, BW/4HANA; SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau or QlikView, SAP Solution Manager
Excellent analytical mindset with ability to communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key stakeholders
Strong communication, networking skills, someone who enjoys working with others and acts as a team player
Strong customer centric, solution-oriented mindset with the ability to propose different solutions for the customers' needs
Strategic and holistic mindset with the ability to manage topics in agile / matrix organizations
Familiar and comfortable with agile ways of working and adaptable to changing environments
English is a must
Skills with Excel Macros, Google office (e.g. G-sheets is a nice to have), database management


Nice to Have:

German would be helpful
SAP Certifications, PMP, ITIL

If this job interests you please do send us your CV today through the link in the advert. However, should you have any questions please contact Elaine Kanwar at +41 61 282 22 23

Title: Visualizations Developer
Description:
The perfect candidate:

The mission of our team is to enable access and work with research data generated during early lead identification and optimization campaigns.

We are looking for a highly motivated Visualizations Developer focusing on developing and maintaining visualizations in Spotfire or Dash Spotly to join our team.

General Information:

• Start date: asap

Tasks & Responsibilities:

Developing and maintaining a dashboard in Spotfire or Dash Spotly for visualizing operational data from drug discovery programs:

• Designing and developing visualizations and dashboards that allow users to intuitively understand key characteristics of their data in Spotfire

• Implementing statistical metrics that are meaningful to visualize key performance indicators

• Suggest new visualizations based on input from business analysts

• Collaborate with a data engineer to define required data transformations and formats

• Document the data flow, configuration, and usage of the implemented solutions

Stack:

• Spotfire and/or Dash Plotly for dashboard development

• Plotly for custom visualizations (optional)

• Python for custom data transformations

• PostgreSQL as the data source

• Lucid Spark for mapping ideas, wireframing, and collaboration

• Gitlab for task and code tracking

• OneDocs for documentation

Must Haves:

• Experience : Strong data visualization skills in e.g. Spotfire or Dash Plotly. Some background in data science (basic statistics). Experience with different visualization platforms. Focus on user-friendly and intuitive design. (*****)

• Execution: You have a passion for working in an environment with high urgency, and you like creating and refining meaningful visualizations in an iterative manner. (*****)

• Proficiency: You’re mastering one or multiple visualization platforms at an advanced level (TIBCO Spotfire preferred). (*****)

• Curiosity and Creativity: You are eager to learn about the key questions in our project and come up with your own ideas to tackle these challenges

• Interest: You understand biomedical or preclinical research data or have previously worked in a Pharma domain.

• Communication : You offer excellent communication skills in English and feel comfortable directly interacting with team members and stakeholders (*****)

Skills:


Development
spotfy
dash plotly




Job Title: Visualizations Developer

Location: Basel, Switzerland

Job Type: Contract

TEKsystems, an Allegis Group company. Allegis Group AG, Aeschengraben 20, CH-4051 Basel, Switzerland. Registration No. CHE-101.865.121. Title: Internship - Data Analytics (Zurich, Switzerland)
Description:
What It's About

We are looking for an Intern to join our Data Office by September 2024 for 4 to 6 months

The main tasks will be the following:


Analyze data about companies in the CRM and Investment sourcing system and develop a model that identifies uniqueness, proposing cleansing actions to data stewards.
Analyze data about companies across various systems, including the mapping from disparate application models to the unified model of the master data system, to propose de-duplication & mapping logic to be applied during data integration & mastering.
Apply PG's AI LLM solutions to prototype an implementation that recognizes core entities within unstructured documents leveraging the pre-trained models with vectorized additional proprietary Partners Group input.



What We Expect


Top performing students in the final phase of their study or who recently graduated from a top university, ideally focused on Computer Science or a Quantitative Degree
Initial work experience in renowned firms in Technology, Data, Analytics or Consultancy is mandatory
Proficiency using AI, LLMs or other data science approaches and Python coding skills
Ability to complete projects on time and accurately, and to multi-task
Strong analytical and people skills with excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to learn and succeed
Proficiency in English is required



What We Offer


Insights into and learnings into the data and analytics space from the world of investments at one of the world's leading private markets investment firms
Flat management structure with significant exposure to senior leaders and decision makers
Steep personal and technical learning curve in a supporting environment with a high degree of ownership and autonomy, yet with structured feedback and training



www.partnersgroup.com

Please be aware, fraudsters may pose as Partners Group recruiters. All genuine representatives can be identified by a verified sign on their LinkedIn profiles. If you suspect fraud or have doubts, contact us immediately at hr@partnersgroup.com

Title: Systems Engineer Azure
Description:
We are looking for a Systems Engineer Azure for an innovative, reliable and responsible company founded in Zurich, which develops the optimal solution based on the client's interesting situation in order to more effectively meet the needs of the constantly evolving market .




Task:

Processing Azure recommendations/measures from various sources (Azure Advisor, Defender for Cloud, information security issues, Entra ID Security Recommendations)
Cloud Organization & Governance work (identification of unneeded resources in Azure and M365, sustainable implementation of Azure Tags & Policies on all subscriptions)
Automation jobs in the area of ​​IaaS and PaaS, (Evaluation: Function or Logic App, implementing sustainable low code, implementing automation in the productive environment)
Introduction of new employees (from mid-September – training in the Azure environment, knowledge transfer of Azure operations (compute, storage, networking), possibly training in containers/AKS if knowledge is available)
Review of the Microsoft 365 environment (recommendation and implementation of improvement measures in the area of ​​security and administration of Office, Teams, SharePoint, introduction of Microsoft Purview)




Requirements/Skills:

Higher education in (business) computer science (university, ETH, FH)
Distinctive customer orientation and high quality standards
Profound experience of several to many years in administration and operation of Azure resources, Microsoft 365 and AKS
Experience working for incident and change management according to ITIL
Excellent knowledge of spoken and written German, understands Swiss German, ideally a Swiss or has already worked in Switzerland







Start: 1/08/2024




End: 31/10/2024 (option to extend)




Daily rate: 800 CHF/d




Location: *Zurich, on-site only, no remote




Application from outside CH: The candidate must hold an EU passport, Schengen state, can also be a second nationality, (nationality outside the Schengen area with a work permit for DE, AT, etc. is not acceptable)

Show more
HTML:
We are looking for a Systems Engineer Azure for an innovative, reliable and responsible company founded in Zurich, which develops the optimal solution based on the client's interesting situation in order to more effectively meet the needs of the constantly evolving market .


Task:

  • Processing Azure recommendations/measures from various sources (Azure Advisor, Defender for Cloud, information security issues, Entra ID Security Recommendations)
  • Cloud Organization & Governance work (identification of unneeded resources in Azure and M365, sustainable implementation of Azure Tags & Policies on all subscriptions)
  • Automation jobs in the area of ​​IaaS and PaaS, (Evaluation: Function or Logic App, implementing sustainable low code, implementing automation in the productive environment)
  • Introduction of new employees (from mid-September – training in the Azure environment, knowledge transfer of Azure operations (compute, storage, networking), possibly training in containers/AKS if knowledge is available)
  • Review of the Microsoft 365 environment (recommendation and implementation of improvement measures in the area of ​​security and administration of Office, Teams, SharePoint, introduction of Microsoft Purview)


Requirements/Skills:

  • Higher education in (business) computer science (university, ETH, FH)
  • Distinctive customer orientation and high quality standards
  • Profound experience of several to many years in administration and operation of Azure resources, Microsoft 365 and AKS
  • Experience working for incident and change management according to ITIL
  • Excellent knowledge of spoken and written German, understands Swiss German, ideally a Swiss or has already worked in Switzerland



Start: 1/08/2024


End: 31/10/2024 (option to extend)


Daily rate: 800 CHF/d


Location: *Zurich, on-site only, no remote


Application from outside CH: The candidate must hold an EU passport, Schengen state, can also be a second nationality, (nationality outside the Schengen area with a work permit for DE, AT, etc. is not acceptable)

Title: BI Analyst/Campaign Data Analyst
Description:
Du arbeitest in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Marketingmanagern, um neue Kampagnen zu entwickeln und Business Stakeholder mit datenbasierten Analysen zu unterstützen. Deine Verantwortungsbereiche umfassen die technische Umsetzung der Datenselektionen für Marketing-Kampagnen sowie die Gewährleistung der Datenqualität. Mit deinen Kenntnissen in SAS/SQL und Python programmierst du die Targeting-Logik für spezifische Kampagnen. Darüber hinaus bist du bereit, Kampagnen in das neue BSI-Kampagnentool zu migrieren, um 1:1-Kampagnen durch triggerbasierte, individuell angepasste Echtzeit-Events zu optimieren.



Möglichkeit, in einem spannenden Umfeld mit zukunftsorientierten Technologien zu arbeiten
Freiraum und Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten im Team
Chance, das zukünftige Marketing mitzugestalten
Innovatives und agiles Teamumfeld



Deine Skills



Abgeschlossenes Studium (Uni/FH) in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Data Science oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Gute Kenntnisse in Python und SQL sowie in der Datenanalyse, idealerweise auch in SAS und BSI
Praktische Erfahrungen in der effizienten und ergebnisorientierten Umsetzung von businessrelevanten Anforderungen
Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch



Was dich auszeichnet



Interesse und Erfahrung im Umfeld von Daten-Analyse/Selektion und Direktmarketing sowie Hands-on Mentalität
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und Cloudtechnologien (AWS) von Vorteil
Marketingaffinität mit guter Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit
Reisebereitschaft zwischen den Standorten Bern und Zürich



Was du draus machst, ist was uns ausmacht.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
We are seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our client's team in the Zug area.




In this role, your primary responsibilities will include advising on data and reporting and defining requirements, and managing the migration of legacy data to the cloud. You will ensure the quality of BI applications and communicate with both internal and external stakeholders.




If you hold a university degree in business informatics or a related field, have several years of experience in business intelligence, SAP BW, and strong knowledge of Power BI, cloud technologies (Snowflake or Azure), and SQL, along with fluency in both German and English, then this opportunity is ideal for you!




If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you in search of a meaningful and rewarding career path?




We are currently looking for an Adobe Data Platform Engineer (m/w/d) to join the Data & AI team where you will have the opportunity to collaborate and work on innovative projects and technology in the banking sector.




As an Adobe Data Platform Engineer, you will assist with the Adobe Experience Platform blueprint and design, encompassing the relevant data platform components.




Responsibilities:







You will collaborate with the Integration Architects and Data Architects to ensure cohesive integration between systems and data models.
Lead a technical POC with 2 other engineering colleagues on adopting newest Adobe products (AEP, CJA, AJO)
Configuring a sandbox according to functional and technical requirements
Evaluate non-functional requirements (performance, stability, usability)
Provide technical solution approaches incl. customization for features, which can not be provided out of the standard functionality




Your profile:




In this role, you are expected to be a Technical Expert / Engineer with deep knowledge and experience in Platform Engineering.
You should have influencing and advisory skills and be responsible for team decisions.
You will engage with multiple teams and contribute to key decisions.
Additionally, you are expected to provide solutions to problems that apply across multiple teams
Expert proficiency in Platform Engineering is required.
Expert proficiency in Data Architecture Principles, Database Architecture, and Technology Architecture Blueprint & Roadmap Definition
Very good understanding of the architecture of Customer Journey Analytics, including how it connects to and integrates with the Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) and AJO
Fluency in English







Your perspective:

Location: Zurich
Duration: ASAP - 4 Months, temporary contract
Onsite Work Schedule: Hybrid
Language: English
Opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Exposure to innovative projects and technology
Competitive pay rate and flexible working arrangements

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Für unseren Kunden in Winterthur suchen wir einen Data Engineer mit technischem Flair, der selbstständig arbeitet und gleichzeitig die Zusammenarbeit im Team schätzt.

Was dich erwartet:


Erstellen von Datenqualitätskontrollen in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Risk Management
Validierung der Datenqualität
Sicherstellen, dass die Daten für Kapitalisierungsanforderungen geeignet sind
Arbeiten in einem technologisch vielfältigen Umfeld
Überprüfen dokumentierter Datenflüsse zur Identifikation zusätzlicher Kontrollen
Implementieren der identifizierten zusätzlichen Kontrollen
Aufbereiten der Informationen zur Dokumentation der Kontrollen



Requirements


Was wir erwarten:


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik oder äquivalente Ausbildung
Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten
Schnelles Erfassen komplexer Datenflüsse
Kenntnisse in der Datenvalidierung
Erfahrung mit JSON
Vertrautheit mit Datenbanken
Kenntnisse in der Google Cloud Plattform
Programmierkenntnisse in Python
Fliessende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Benefits

aietes Temp Contracting bietet dir die Möglichkeit, deine Expertise in verschiedenen Projekten innerhalb unseres langjährigen Kundennetzwerks einzubringen. Neben der Bereitstellung temporärer Mitarbeiter für Kundenprojekte unterstützen wir auch bei der Vermittlung von Festanstellungen.

Unser Team begleitet dich während des gesamten Rekrutierungs- und Vorstellungsprozesses und bietet Coaching für Vorstellungsgespräche an, um deine beruflichen Ziele zu unterstützen.

aietes Temp Contracting steht für individuelle Betreuung und langfristige Karrieremöglichkeiten.

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Wir akzeptieren für diese Stelle ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen. Den Abschluss von Verträgen mit Personalvermittlern sowie die damit verbundenen AGB und Provisionsansprüche lehnen wir ausdrücklich ab. Erhalten wir Bewerbungen über Personalvermittler ohne diese vorab beauftragt zu haben, werden diese wie Direktbewerbungen behandelt.
